under Rongli Sub-Division, is known for its natural and landscaped beauty. 
It is located on the edge of the
, and can be reached in about four hours' drive from

via either Pakyong or Rangpo. 

Isolated from the rest of the state, on the far eastern border of Sikkim and bounded by
, the region is characterized by lush forest, mountains and rivers. The Aritar Lake (Ghati-Tso) is a nearby attraction, as are traditional villages and monasteries such as
. Visitors may also stay in a British-built bungalow of 1895 located half km below the lake.

Initially one of the oldest natural lake in Sikkim and recently artificially constructed to facilitate boating for the tourists. At an altitude of 4600 ft (1,400 m) it is the only lake with boating facility in Sikkim.

Popularly known as Ari-Bangla it is an old British built bunglow built by Sir James Claude White (first political officer of Sikkim during British rule in India) in the year 1895. At the same premises Sikkim’s first treasury was built as well as Sikkim Police was raised and the first outpost started functioning in the year 1897.

A monastery of the Kagyuapa order,considered as one of the holiest and oldest in Sikkim.The visitor’s can imbibe the tranquil air with splendour of monastic arts reflected in its traditional architecture, carved & painted murals and treasure of manuscripts and icons.

The most venerated
shrine with picturesque splendour is considered a very holy pilgrimage site, where thousands of
devotees throng for the blessing and
participate during the month of “SAWAN” to offer
water and sip the sacred water from a sacred vessel.
“Mangkhim”, a Temple of the Rai ethnic group of
i origin is located at a height of 6500 ft at “Maity Village” (Kheselakha) . Hattipailay is another virgin village where the visitors can see elephant footprints on rock.

value: (Tample) of Rai ethnic group of Nepali Origin

This place situated about 5 km (approx) from
Bazar, is an abode of “Nirmal Guruji” (a.k.a.) “ Kopchey Baba”, known for his miraculious healing power, which has attracted hundreds of devotees from all over India and neghbouring countries.

value: Ever green nursery & Ram Gauri Sangrhalaya :

Bazar, the nursery and museum is privately owned and has drift wood collections, botanical & other varieties of flowers.
